::: {.cell}

:::


::: {.cell}

:::

This page provides information about the valid indicative distribution map for the ecosystem functional group [**M1.4 Shellfish beds and reefs**](/efg-info/M1_4.qmd). For older or alternative maps, see [here](/map-info/M1_4_history.qmd).

## Methods

Here is the methods summary for **Map code and version**: M1.4.web.orig v1.0.

> Major and minor occurrences of shellfish beds and reefs were identified by overlaying a global map of oyster reefs (Beck et al. 2011) on marine ecoregions (Spalding et al. 2008), and then clipping to the extent of the marine ‘shelf’ base layer as mapped by Harris et al. (2014b). Occurrences were converted to 30 arc second spatial resolution.

::: {.cell}

:::



::: {.cell}

:::



### Datasets

**GSFM-2014** (Harris PT et al. 2014):

Source of _topography and geomorphology_.
 Resolution: variable (polygons), static.
 Accuracy evaluation: quantitative (subsets).

 **MEOW-2008** (Spalding MD et al.  2008):

Source of _biogeographical range_.
 Resolution: variable (polygons), static.
 Accuracy evaluation: qualitative (experts judgement).

 **Oyster-reef-list** (Beck MW et al. 2011):

Source of _validated distribution records_.
 Resolution: variable (points), static.
 Accuracy evaluation: known records.

::: {.cell}
::: {.cell-output-display}


|dataset   |url                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |

|MEOW-2008 |<https://www.worldwildlife.org/publications/marine-ecoregions-of-the-world-a-bioregionalization-of-coastal-and-shelf-areas>{target='links'} :: <https://databasin.org/datasets/3b6b12e7bcca419990c9081c0af254a2>{target='links'} :: <http://maps.tnc.org/gis_data.html>{target='links'} |


:::
:::

### Processing

Processing steps used in this map are: *Selection* :: *Clipping*.

### Map evaluation


This map is considered to be a ***Coarse quality map*** based on the following characteristics:

Concept alignment is *Semi-direct,general*.

Ground observations are _no_.

 The accuracy evaluation *Known records,undocumented*.

## How to use the data

### Available files

:::{.aside}

Following maps are considered current and valid indicative distribution maps for this ecosystem functional group. `Web navigation` maps are optimised for use in webapps, but they have similar methods and differ only in details of format and processing. 

- Web navigation (**code: M1.4.web.orig**, version v1.0) 
 - Indicative Map (**code: M1.4.IM.orig**, version v1.0) 


:::

You can download geospatial data for this map from the following sources:

**M1.4.web.orig** (v1.0): [Google Cloud bucket](gs://iucn_get_l3_im/M1.4.web.orig_v1.0.tif){target="gisdata"} :: [Zenodo repository (bundle of maps)](http://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.5090419){target="gisdata"} :: [Zenodo repository (EFG map)](https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.5090931){target="gisdata"} :: [Mapbox tileset](https://studio.mapbox.com/tilesets/jrfep.M1_4_web_orig){target="gisdata"} :: [GitHub repository](layers/M1.4.web.orig_v1.0_topo.json){target="gisdata"} :: [GitHub repository](M1.4.web.orig_v1.0_topo.json){target="gisdata"} :: [Earth Engine assets](projects/earthengine-legacy/assets/users/jrferrerparis/IUCN-GET/L3_IndMaps/){target="gisdata"}

**M1.4.IM.orig** (v1.0): [Google Cloud bucket](gs://iucn_get_l3_im/M1.4.IM.orig_v1.0.tif){target="gisdata"} :: [Zenodo repository (bundle of maps)](http://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.3958934){target="gisdata"}

Note that you need to login to some services like [mapbox](https://www.mapbox.com){target="links"} or [earthengine](https://earthengine.google.com){target="links"}, and in some cases you also need to request access to the files.

###  License information

Indicative maps have been released with a ![](https://zenodo.org/static/icons/licenses/cc-by-icon.svg){height=20} Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International license. 

Datasets used to create this map might have some restriction for commercial use, see details below.


::: {.cell}
